issues.title: Missing Prohibition on Registered Sex Offenders on School Grounds
issues.description: California law generally prohibits registered sex offenders from coming onto school grounds or into school buildings. While the regulation addresses notification when permission is granted, neither document establishes the baseline prohibition or the limited circumstances under which exceptions may be made.

legal_citations.text: Any person who is required to register as a sex offender pursuant to Section 290 and who comes into any school building or upon any school ground without lawful business thereon is guilty of a misdemeanor.

issues.required_language: Registered sex offenders are prohibited from coming onto school grounds or into school buildings unless they have lawful business thereon. Any registered sex offender who violates this prohibition is guilty of a misdemeanor under Penal Code 626.81.

issues.title: Missing Definition of "Lawful Business"
issues.description: The regulation references granting permission to registered sex offenders but does not define what constitutes "lawful business" or establish clear criteria for when such permission may be granted, creating potential inconsistency in application.

legal_citations.text: Any person who is required to register as a sex offender pursuant to Section 290 and who comes into any school building or upon any school ground without lawful business thereon is guilty of a misdemeanor.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures defining what constitutes "lawful business" for registered sex offenders on school grounds, including criteria for granting permission and required approvals.

issues.title: Missing Reference to School Activities Off Campus
issues.description: While the policy mentions "school-related activities," it does not specifically address notification procedures for registered sex offenders who may be present at off-campus school activities or field trip locations.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of a school district may initiate and carry on any program, activity, or may otherwise act in any manner which is not in conflict with or inconsistent with, or preempted by, any law and which is not in conflict with the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: The district liaison shall coordinate with law enforcement to receive information about registered sex offenders who may be present at off-campus school activities, field trips, or other school-sponsored events.

issues.title: Missing Staff Training Requirements
issues.description: While the regulation mentions training school staff about roles and responsibilities, it does not specify what training content should be provided or how frequently training should occur.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of each school district shall provide for the training of certificated employees in the detection of child abuse and neglect.

issues.required_language: Staff training shall include procedures for handling sex offender information, reporting requirements, appropriate responses when a registered sex offender is observed on campus, and confidentiality requirements. Training shall be provided annually or as needed.
